alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Pocahontas County through 1045 PM EDT... At 1017 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong line of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Salty Fork to Hillsboro, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Cass Scenic Railroad, Snowshoe, Hillsboro, Edray, Buckeye, Dunmore, Cranberry Mountain Nature Center, Slaty Fork, and Minnehaha Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph
